title: Comparison pages: honest tradeoffs
content:
Comparison pages: honest tradeoffs

Create comparisons that AI can quote without distortion.

Learning goal

  • Build one comparison table for 2–3 products.
  • Include who it’s for / not for.

Why it matters

  • AI often gets “X vs Y”: provide real data.
  • Honesty lowers returns.

Explanation

  • Table: key features, price, policy, who for/not, PDP link.

Examples

  • Good: “X stable, Y lighter; X pricier; Y less warranty.”
  • Poor: “Both are awesome!” with no data.

Guided exercise (10–15 min)

  1. Create a table for 2–3 products: features, price, policy, who for/not, PDP link.

Independent exercise (5–10 min)

Make another for a different pair.

Self-check

  • Table done with links.
  • Who for/not included.
  • Policy/price accurate.

Optional deepening

  • Copilot merchant blog: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-copilot/blog/2025/04/18/introducing-the-copilot-merchant-program/
